intro: Alsine oxyphylla, commonly known as the common sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain one or two seeds. Alsine oxyphylla is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
